instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to investigate the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) calculated by the Boltzmann plot method and welding quality?
Output: In the related study, the researchers used uv spectrum,visible spectrum and nir spectrum to investigate the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) calculated by the Boltzmann plot method and welding quality.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed to investigate the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) calculated by the Boltzmann plot method and welding quality?
Output: Wavelet packet transform (WPT) was employed to investigate the correlation between electron temperature (Te) calculated by the Boltzmann plot method and welding quality.

instruction: What metric was chosen to investigate the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) calculated by the Boltzmann plot method and welding quality, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The electron temperature (Te) was chosen as the metric to investigate the correlation between Te and welding quality. The metric can go as far as accurately predicting the welding quality with a 92% average accuracy using a prediction model based on ELM.

instruction: What machine learning model was used to build the prediction model of welding quality based on the spectral features in the related study investigating the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) and welding quality?
Output: The machine learning model used to build the prediction model of welding quality based on the spectral features in the related study is the extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the use of additional spectral signals accurately describe the weld seam state and improve the prediction accuracy for welding quality in the related study investigating the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) and welding quality?
Output: Yes, the use of additional spectral signals can accurately describe the weld seam state and improve the prediction accuracy for welding quality in the related study investigating the correlation between electron temperature (T-e) and welding quality. The related study states that in consideration of the limit of the single temperature curve, six more spectral signals are discussed for describing the weld seam state accurately. These additional spectral signals, along with the electron temperature curve, are used to build the prediction model of welding quality based on extreme learning machine (ELM). The proposed methodologies are verified to be effective with high prediction accuracy.
